name: residually
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
in a way that remains after most of something has gone: The batteries retain some power residually even when they have stopped working. Her cheeks were residually pink several minutes after the awkward meeting.
More examplesFewer examplesThe analysis showed that the site of the accident was residually contaminated.The principles established in the early days of the industry have survived residually today.The work ethic from his childhood still lingered residually and made it hard for him to relax, even in old age.
